agents.name: Top Hackathon Finder
agents.description:
Task: create an agent which searches for the best upcoming hackathons and filters out the top (n) ones
Workflow steps (execute in order):
  1. Search for upcoming hackathon events from multiple source
agents.prompt: create an agent which searches for the best upcoming hackathons and filters out the top (n) ones

endpoints.summary: Search for upcoming hackathons and return the top N filtered results

body_parameters.name: n
body_parameters.description: Number of top hackathons to return

agents.task_description:
Task: create an agent which searches for the best upcoming hackathons and filters out the top (n) ones
Workflow steps (execute in order):
  1. Search for upcoming hackathon events from multiple sources (Web search APIs or hackathon platforms) — Retrieves raw list of upcoming hackathon events with basic details
  2. Extract and standardize hackathon details (Data processing service) — Normalizes hackathon data including dates, locations, prizes, themes, and requirements
  3. Define ranking criteria for hackathon quality (Configuration service) — Establishes scoring metrics such as prize money, organizer reputation, participant limits, and theme relevance
  4. Score and rank all hackathons based on defined criteria (Data analysis service) — Produces ranked list of hackathons with quality scores
  5. Filter and select the top n hackathons from ranked list (Data filtering service) — Returns the specified number of highest-scoring hackathons
  6. Format and present the top hackathons with key details (Output formatting service) — Delivers final list with hackathon names, dates, locations, prizes, and application links
Endpoint 0: POST /search-top-hackathons — Search for upcoming hackathons and return the top N filtered results
Parameters:
- n (int, body, endpoint 0): Specifies how many of the best hackathons to filter and return from the search results

agents.name: Notion Course Calendar Sync
agents.description:
Task: create an agent that receives a notion page link. extracts all the main courses and their schedules from the page. based on the extracted data it creates events on my google calendar.
Workflow s
agents.prompt: create an agent that receives a notion page link. extracts all the main courses and their schedules from the page. based on the extracted data it creates events on my google calendar.

endpoints.summary: Extract course schedules from Notion page and create corresponding Google Calendar events

body_parameters.name: notion_page_link
body_parameters.description: The Notion page URL containing course and schedule information

agents.task_description:
Task: create an agent that receives a notion page link. extracts all the main courses and their schedules from the page. based on the extracted data it creates events on my google calendar.
Workflow steps (execute in order):
  1. Parse the Notion page link to extract the page ID — Extract the page identifier from the provided Notion URL
  2. Get the Notion page content by page ID (Notion) — Retrieve the full page content including all blocks and data
  3. Extract main courses and their schedules from the page content (Notion) — Parse the page content to identify course names, dates, times, and any other schedule details
  4. Transform the extracted course data into calendar event format — Convert course information into structured event objects with title, start time, end time, and description
  5. Get the target Google Calendar ID (Google Calendar) — Identify which calendar to create events in (primary calendar or specific calendar)
  6. Create calendar events for each main course (Google Calendar) — Add each course as a separate event in the Google Calendar with the extracted schedule information
Endpoint 0: POST /create-calendar-events-from-notion — Extract course schedules from Notion page and create corresponding Google Calendar events
Services: Notion, Google Calendar
Parameters:
- notion_page_link (str, body, endpoint 0): Notion page to extract course data from
- calendar_id (str, path, endpoint 1): Target calendar for creating course events
- event_title (str, body, endpoint 1): Course name extracted from Notion page to use as event title
- start_datetime (str, body, endpoint 1): Course schedule start time extracted from Notion page
- end_datetime (str, body, endpoint 1): Course schedule end time extracted from Notion page
